alert.note: Alert for Western Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:01PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Passaic and southern Orange Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 301 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Vernon Valley, or 7 miles west of Warwick, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Milford, Ringwood, Pompton Lakes, Monroe, Warwick, Goshen, Bloomingdale, Chester, Greenwood Lake, Florida, Harriman, Unionville, Upper Greenwood Lake, Kiryas Joel and Wanaque. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
